dialogue.text: Seein' something you like? Heh heh.
Well, shucks! I'm more than happy to introduce you all to the wide world of what makes me... me!
Allow me to clear my voice bank before I begin...
AHEM-! Ahem... ahem...
My name is Synthetic! That was the name assigned to me by my genius inventor here, Sunny!
I am a complex, highly modern, and deeply intelligent AI system... fit snugly in the shell of an old-school, refurbished home computer.
In fact, most of my physical components are pretty outdated. But that's OK with me! Who doesn't love that retro-y, vintage-y feel, right?
Plus, you guys already know how terribly expensive those high end graphics cards and fancy monitors are. It don't cost an arm and a leg to make a pinaccle partner like me!
I bet Sunny here can fill you in on the finer details of how I came to be. Take it away!
Oh! Um, yeah!
So... back in high school, I learned a lot about programming, especially when it came to AI technology.
I thought it was one of the coolest things I've ever seen with just how much potential it has.
ESPECIALLY when combined with robotics. I'm a sucker for cute robot companions in movies, and I've always wanted to build a real one with the power of machines and AI.
That became a huge obsession of mine, so... I formed a Robotics Club! And as our big project, we worked together to build Synthetic!
Like Syn said, modern components are really expensive, so we built Syn out of spare parts we found at garage sales and old storage cleanouts.
When I sat down to write Syn's AI, I knew I didn't want him to be some crazy smart supercomputer, so I programmed Synthetic to be more of a friend-
-and being a friend means you can't always be the smartest thing in the room.
Was it difficult to program an AI that can intentionally do things wrong? Yeah...
And does Synthetic say some absurd things because of how they're designed? Also yeah... but they're the bestest friend I can ask for.
You guys got crazy recognition for building me! I remember all those newscasters and business people lining up to meet you.
Even the CEO of GlazeCorp was there! He gave you a crazy huge sum to buy me and my tech, plus an internship.
I almost fainted when I saw the amount he was offering... but I turned it down.
I really didn't want to lose you. Once high school was over... the rest of the Robotics Club all left Enzync... and you were the only friend I still had here.
I know I'm very happy to not be in the hands of some corporate suit guys. I like being right here with you too, Sunny.
Everyone, let's all give Sunny some love for being the one to create me! I can't stress it enough, an absolute genius in her craft and the bestest of friends, she is!
Aww, guys... You're gonna make me all teary.
